Message: As a coach I would like you to oblige me to improve but physically I can't do it anymore.

It's natural to feel exhausted after giving your best, but remember, progress often comes from facing challenges, even when they seem insurmountable. Let's take a moment to rest, regroup, and plan for the next session where we'll work on refining what you've learned so far
I have to win the marathon but I don't want to train myself.

Your desire to win the marathon is commendable, and I'm here to support that goal. However, true greatness comes not only from the will to win, but the discipline to train. Let's focus on making training more enjoyable, setting achievable milestones, and building the drive
You are doing your job as coach, but I really don't have time.

Time management is crucial in balancing aspirations with daily life. Let's explore creative ways to incorporate training into your schedule, breaking it down into smaller, more manageable segments. We'll make every second count towards your marathon dream.
